page.title: 19PRESSMENNAN FOREST TRAIL
page.content: {PRESSMENNAN FOREST TRAIL} The trail opened in 1971 and is about 2 miles long.It can be walked in less than 2 hours.In some places you can get a good view of Stenton and lots of other places round about and also the coast line. {Pressmennan }was once part of Beil estate.Now it belongs to the Forestry Commission.It was once famous for its oakwoods but since 1955 other species have been planted with the oak thus making fuller use of the ground. From the picnic area you can see the mouth of the River Tyne.In the foreground on the opposite side of the lake lies {Pressmennan }farm which is an example of stone and pantile farm steadings built in the late 18th century throughout East Lothian. We love to go up to { {Pressmennan }for a walk.{
